devdoc.details: Step 3: Learning how multisig wallets work  LEARNING POINT: This is a simple multisig wallet that requires both parties to approve any transaction before it can be executed. This ensures shared control.

approveTransaction(uint256).details: Each owner can approve once. When both approve, transaction can be executed.

params.transactionId: The ID of the transaction to approve  LEARNING POINT: This is the core of multisig - both parties must approve. If you approve, you can't un-approve (for simplicity in this learning version).

params._owner2: Second owner address  LEARNING POINT: Both owners must be different addresses. This creates a 2-of-2 multisig where both must approve transactions.

createTransaction(address,uint256,bytes).details: Either owner can create a transaction, but both must approve to execute

params.value: Amount of ETH to send (in wei)

returns.transactionId: The ID of the created transaction  LEARNING POINT: Creating a transaction doesn't execute it. Both owners must approve before it can be executed.

executeTransaction(uint256).details: Can only execute if both owners have approved (2-of-2 requirement)

params.transactionId: The ID of the transaction to execute  LEARNING POINT: This is where the 2-of-2 requirement is enforced. Both owners must have approved before execution is possible.

returns.transaction: The transaction details  LEARNING POINT: This is a view function - anyone can check transaction status.

returns._0: True if the owner has approved

devdoc.title: SimpleMultisig

getBalance().notice: Get the balance of this multisig wallet

hasApproved(uint256,address).notice: Check if an owner has approved a transaction

userdoc.notice: A simple 2-of-2 multisig wallet for collaboration
